Key Match Events: The Blue Jays scored 6 runs, with key contributions from Vladimir Guerrero Jr. and Alejandro Kirk.
The Red Sox were unable to score until the sixth inning, ending a streak of scoring in previous games.
The game marked the final road game for the Red Sox, who were eliminated from postseason contention with this loss.
Post-Match Reflections: The Red Sox were officially eliminated from the postseason with this loss.
The Blue Jays extended their winning streak with the victory.
The loss ended any playoff hopes for the Red Sox, who needed to win at least one of their remaining games to avoid a losing record.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Charlie Morton signed with the Orioles, a separate transaction not directly related to the game.
The game was the final road game for the Red Sox, who returned to Boston for their final series.
The Red Sox's performance in the sixth inning provided a glimmer of hope, but the Blue Jays' strong pitching and offense proved too much.
